intro: Licania hookeri var. obtusa, commonly known as the broad-leaved licania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves that are typically covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. It produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or white in color. This variant is distinguished by its more rounded leaf shape compared to other varieties within the species.
